sentence.Network_en: His catering business made him a millionaire at 41.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的饮食服务公司使他在41岁成了百万富翁。

sentence.Network_en: By the time he died, he was a millionaire.
sentence.Network_cn: 到他去世的时候，他已经是一位百万富翁了。

sentence.Network_en: Jackie sees the comedy in her millionaire husband's thrifty habits.
sentence.Network_cn: 杰姬觉得自己的百万富翁丈夫的一些节俭习惯很是滑稽。

the British study showed that in 1998 , the average male millionaire was worth 2.71 million ( AUS $ 6.51m ) , while the female equivalent owned just 1.28m.该项英国调查显示，1998年男百万富翁的财富平均为271万英镑，而女富翁的这一数字仅为128万。
Only a millionaire can afford the price ., 只有大富翁才出得起这个价.

to sell such a suit as that to a millionaire ., 把这样一套西服卖给一个百万富翁.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from French millionnaire, from million (see million)

entry.def: A millionaire is a very rich person who has money or property worth at least a million pounds or dollars.

example.ex: By the time he died, he was a millionaire.
example.tran: 到他去世的时候，他已经是一位百万富翁了。

means.word_mean: 1. a person whose material wealth is valued at more than a million dollars
